intro: Cactus sulphureus, commonly known as the golden cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which bloom during the warmer months. The plant has a cylindrical stem that is covered in spines, which help to reduce water loss and deter herbivores. Its succulent structure allows it to store water efficiently, adapting to its harsh environment. The flowers are often pollinated by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance in desert ecosystems.
